Treatment considerations: Disease progression to advanced phase while on TKI therapy has worse prognosis than de novo advanced phase CML
Evaluation for allogeneic HCT as indicated
Selection of TKI is based on prior therapy and/or BCR::ABL1 mutation profile
CNS involvement has been described in BP-CML. Lumbar puncture and CNS prophylaxis is recommended for lymphoid BP-CML

Options: Preferred regimens: 2G TKI (Bosutinib, Dasatinib, or Nilotinib) or 3G TKI (Ponatinib)
Useful in certain circumstances: 1G TKI (Imatinib) if 2G or 3G TKI is contraindicated

Options: Preferred regimens: ALL-type induction chemotherapy (NCCN Guidelines for ALL) + TKI
Useful in certain circumstances: TKI + steroids (if not a candidate for induction chemotherapy)
For patients in remission: Consolidation chemotherapy and TKI maintenance for non-candidates for allogeneic HCT

Options: Preferred regimens: AML-type induction chemotherapy (NCCN Guidelines for AML) + TKI
Useful in certain circumstances: TKI (if not a candidate for induction chemotherapy)
For patients in remission: Consolidation chemotherapy and TKI maintenance for non-candidates for allogeneic HCT
